p: Plant species are recognized by possess compounds with spasmolytic activity relieving cramps that are an important symptom of gastrointestinal disorders. In this context, the effect of an ethanolic extract from the aerial parts of Leptohyptis macrostachys (syn. Hyptis macrostachys) was assessed on smooth muscle models. The results demonstrated that the extract presented spasmolytic action (27–729 μg/mL) on guinea pig ileum, by blockage of calcium channels, in a concentration-dependent manner ( de Souza et al., 2013). Furthermore, the α-pyrone hyptenolide ( 191) isolated from the aerial parts of the same species was also able to inhibit the contractions induced by carbachol or histamine in guinea pig ileum, demonstrating the spasmolytic activity of this compound ( Costa et al., 2014).
